page.title: 09INNERLEITHEN ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Weekly rehearsals continue through the winter months in preparation for the annual production of the{opera}which runs for one week and attracts large crowds from all over the Borders and beyond.At present there are between forty and fifty keen amateur members from Innerleithen and district and the standard of singing is exceptionally high.The conductor and musical director is Mr Jack Waldie,who is also organist and choir master at the local parish church. If necessary as in last years Carousel the members' children also take the stage,and there is a very experienced stage crew who think nothing of extending the stage in the Memorial Hall.Beginning in 1909 with Gilbert and Sullivan the choice has been wide from The Desert Song to The Dancing Years from The King and I to Oklahoma.
